summary: An ordinance submitting to the qualified voters of the City of Seattle, at the general election to be held in such city on Tuesday, March 11, 1924, the proposition of creating an indebtedness in the sum of Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000.00) and the issuance and sale therefor of general negotiable interest bearing coupon bonds of said City in said amount, for the purpose of constructing a bridge across Lake Washington Canal at Montlake Boulevard.
